content: Personally I’ve never blocked anyone, but I’d say sure, block anyone you want to prevent YOURSELF from having to deal with their comments. The problem I’m addressing is that when you block someone who’s commented on your article, NO ONE gets to see their comment anymore. This would be like the writer of an article in some publication getting to “mute” comments they don’t happen to like, so that no one could see that comment unless they had a direct link to its individual URL. If you’re a writer, you should be prepared for criticism, and as long as it’s not abusive, you shouldn’t have the option to prevent anyone other than yourself from seeing it.
